events.description: A trade agreement cutting US tariffs on Indian goods from 50% to 18% while maintaining protections for certain agricultural products.
Upcoming legislative session regarding the national budget.
The Reserve Bank of India's scheduled meeting to decide on interest rates.

facts.fact_text: The Indian rupee rose toward 90.1 per dollar, reaching its strongest level in over three weeks.

evidences.evidence_text: The Indian rupee rose toward 90.1 per dollar, extending gains to its strongest level in over three weeks

facts.fact_text: The US-India trade deal reduces US tariffs on Indian goods from 50% to 18%.

evidences.evidence_text: US-India trade deal, which cuts US tariffs on Indian goods from 50% to 18%

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India’s interest rate decision is scheduled for February 6, 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Reserve Bank of India’s interest rate decision scheduled for February 6, 2026.

claims.claim_text: Corporate flows continued to influence the currency.

evidences.evidence_text: Corporate flows continued to influence the currency

claims.claim_text: Easing forward premiums and increased exporter hedging have helped temper near-term depreciation pressures.

evidences.evidence_text: easing forward premiums and increased exporter hedging have helped temper near-term depreciation pressures.

claims.claim_text: The trade deal underpins Indian assets.
claims.author: Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: Analysts say the deal underpins Indian assets

claims.claim_text: Sustained gains for the rupee will depend on clarity around implementation and broader capital flows.
claims.author: Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: sustained gains will depend on clarity around implementation and broader capital flows.

evidence.evidence_text: the currency continues to draw some support from the recent US-India trade deal
Corporate flows continued to influence the currency
increased exporter hedging have helped temper near-term depreciation pressures.
Investors remain cautious ahead of developments in the Budget session and the Reserve Bank of India’s interest rate decision
